programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: UFO sightings throughout the world during the highly active period of the 1970s. The sightings spread across locations from Kansas to New Zealand.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos examines the notion that extraterrestrials could have left clues to the universe's mysteries. Experts investigate cryptic puzzles that might have been placed by ancient aliens.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers head to Dan and Laura's house for a charity white elephant gift exchange. It might well be for charity, but will the warriors leave their competitive sides at the door?.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth and Les argue over an important decision, while a scientist turns up in the shop claiming his vintage device can cure diseases.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A couple try to exchange a pair of earrings for a promise ring, but Les declares the stones purchased for $1,000 as fake.

programme.title: Stan Lee's Superhumans
programme.desc: The comic-book creator and Daniel Browning Smith find a man with incredible yoyo skills as they search the world for people with unusual abilities.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: How detectives uncovered the identity of the South Side rapist, a man who terrorised the women of Missouri for over six years.

programme.title: Strippers: Cars for Cash
programme.desc: The teams find a Triumph Herald and Ford Anglia as they search for 1960s cars to strip to a shell and compete to make the most profit in scrap value.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth and Les argue over an important decision, while a scientist turns up in the shop claiming his vintage device can cure diseases.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A couple try to exchange a pair of earrings for a promise ring, but Les declares the stones purchased for $1,000 as fake.

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Experts try to uncover the truth about alien remains by investigating reports of extraterrestrial bodies recovered from crashed UFOs.

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: A look at the world's hottest UFO zones, where physical and paranormal phenomena, unidentified objects and aliens are reported with alarming frequency.

programme.title: In Search of Aliens
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos investigates whether alien encounters influenced the establishing acts of the Founding Fathers as he travels to Washington, DC.

programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: Investigation into a possible alien visitation to England in December 1980, when Air Force personnel claimed they saw strange lights hovering in the sky.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts examine the link between aliens and the Civil War, exploring Abraham Lincoln's strange visions and ghostly images seen at Gettysburg.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Part one of two. A ventriloquist leaves Karen and Bobby J speechless, and an angry mixed martial arts fighter takes a swing at Byron.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Part two of two. The Golds' million-dollar art deal takes more twists and turns, but eventually Les shakes hands on the single biggest purchase in store history.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Cousin Karen is ready to shake things up on the showroom floor, but Ashley is less than thrilled to have someone invading her turf.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: When Les takes his niece Karen under his wing to help out at the jewellery counter, Ashley fails to conceal her jealousy well.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth thinks Les is stuck in the past for hand-delivering their gold to a refinery, and bets his father that his new mail order service will improve things.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Tensions between Karen and Ashley explode on the sales floor, so Les puts them both in the doghouse. Documentary series following the daily running of a pawn shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les goes on a buying spree that leaves his staff wondering what is going on. Meanwhile, Karen needs Byron's help to handle a pair of unruly piano players.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A hustler tries to make Les an offer he cannot refuse, but the Golds fight back and turn the tables on the shady customer.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The shop's biggest gambles, including an antique White Eagle medallion, a book signed by 'Shoeless' Joe Jackson, a Gibson mandolin and a rare Albrecht Durer etching.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Revisit some of the most expensive items in the shop as Pawn Stars splash the cash for a 1961 Fender Stratocaster guitar, Mickey Mouse display items, and a Star Wars collection..

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The force is strong as the gang encounter a treasure trove of Star Wars related memorabilia, including an original 'Revenge of the Jedi' poster, and a Jabba the Hutt Play-Doh set..

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The 80s have taken over as the Pawn Stars look back at some of their favourite items..

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The 80s have taken over as the Pawn Stars look back at some of their favourite items..

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The 80s have taken over as the Pawn Stars look back at some of their favourite items..

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The 80s have taken over as the Pawn Stars look back at some of their favourite items..

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: As Christmas approaches, the staff members look over alleged American revolutionary war currency and a battleaxe.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy and Rene pool their resources to get the better of Darrell and Brandon, while Jarrod and Brandi regain their passion for bidding.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell finds a sweet way to distract the other bidders. Meanwhile, Jarrod and Brandi plan a four-year anniversary party for their Orange Store..

programme.title: Wicked Tuna
programme.desc: Some huge catches threaten to mix up the leader board with the Pin Wheel crew in prime position to beat the rival boat FV-Tuna.com.

programme.title: Superheroes Decoded
programme.desc: Part one of two. A look at how comic-book characters took over mainstream culture, dominating the box office and becoming part of the global zeitgeist.

programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: Investigation into a possible alien visitation to England in December 1980, when Air Force personnel claimed they saw strange lights hovering in the sky.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies returns to set tasks for Dave Gorman, Al Murray, Rob Beckett, Sara Pascoe and Paul Chowdhry involving vegetable propulsion, snowmen and Swedes.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: BBC Breakfast presenter Steph McGovern takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz from October 2018, with Pointless co-host Richard Osman and broadcaster Joan Bakewell joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: In an episode first broadcast in 2013, Mrs Brown's Boys star Brendan O'Carroll and stand-ups Jo Brand and Phill Jupitus join regular panellist Alan Davies for a festive edition of the comedy quiz. Host Stephen Fry asks them a range of unusual questions on the theme of Kris Kringle and other Christmas-related topics.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show, with regular team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack joined by Rebecca Front, Jack Whitehall, Nick Hewer and Miranda Hart, who try to deceive their opponents with plausible lies and absurd facts about themselves.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by guests Robert Webb, Terry Wogan, Katy Wix and Kevin Bridges on the panel show. Rob Brydon chairs as the contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and regular panellist Hugh Dennis look back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of fellow comedians Angela Barnes, Ed Byrne, Milton Jones, Nish Kumar and Romesh Ranganathan. Stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Modern Wheels or Classic Steals
programme.desc: A former British Championship racer wants to swap his Ford Focus for a two-door sports car, and is pitched options including a Ford Mustang Coupe and a Lotus Elise.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Teams battle against the clock in an extreme downhill race at the beautiful landscaped gardens of Villa Borghese, Rome.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve and his team of explorers head to Greenland in the Arctic. Kayaking the world's largest fjord, they dodge giant icebergs and hungry polar bears.

programme.title: Top Gear: Top Fails
programme.desc: A look back at all that Top Gear has tried and failed to accomplish, including spectacular fails, mixing shorter, one-off catastrophes with longer, more developed failures.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May set out to boost the British economy by embarking on a trade mission to India. Equipped with three old British cars and a range of uniquely British products, they set off on an epic road trip across one of the world's most fascinating and challenging countries, devotedly promoting Britain - with distinctly mixed results.

programme.title: Top Gear: Winter Blunderland
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May present their best winter challenges, including playing ice hockey with Suzukis and what occurs if you ski-jump a rocket-powered Mini.

programme.title: Top Gear: Winter Blunderland
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May present their best winter challenges, including playing ice hockey with Suzukis and what occurs if you ski-jump a rocket-powered Mini.

programme.title: Top Gear: Winter Blunderland
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May present their best winter challenges.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May embark on a road trip, trying to follow the path of the Three Wise Men across the Middle East. However, they opt to do so in open-top sports cars that were built for significantly less demanding tasks than driving along the conflict-ridden mountains of southern Turkey, through war-ravaged Iraq and across the searing deserts of Syria. The trio also try to find out what myrrh is and where it can be bought.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May travel to America for an interstate road trip, completing various challenges along the way. Starting in Miami, they each buy a car for less than $1,000 and drive to New Orleans, where they set out to give their vehicles away to people who suffered in Hurricane Katrina.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: More thrills, spills, customer carts and crashes in this extreme downhill battle at the Eduardo VII Park in Lisbon.

programme.title: World's Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Twenty Twelve co-stars Hugh Bonneville and Jessica Hynes pair up again to go on a road trip through the former Soviet republic of Georgia. Driving from the border with Azerbaijan to the Black Sea, Jessica soon discovers her spirit of adventure is causing Hugh a few moments of high anxiety, but there is worse to come when they find themselves stuck on a high mountain pass in bad weather and he has to overcome his vertigo. While the drive is a challenge all the way, the country and its people delight and surprise them at every turn.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Josh Widdicombe, Cariad Lloyd and Paul Sinha join regular panellist Alan Davies, as questionmaster Sandi Toksvig considers various phenomena. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window as the panellists attempt to answer the fiendishly difficult questions, with points invariably awarded for the answers the questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites another three celebrities to reveal their pet hates in the hope he will banish them to Room 101. Actor, comedian and game-show host Alexander Armstrong reveals how he finds certain cocktail ingredients pointless, athlete Kelly Holmes is fed up of being given the runaround by the M25, and veteran sports commentator Henry Blofeld argues that people talking to him at breakfast simply isn't cricket.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites another three celebrities to reveal their pet hates in the hope he will banish them to Room 101. Veteran entertainer Des O'Connor reveals how he doesn't care for birthdays any more, broadcaster Adrian Chiles admits that women's shoes aren't for him and former Radio 1 Chart Show presenter Jameela Jamil isn't too keen on flatmates.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and regular panellist Hugh Dennis look back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of fellow comedians Angela Barnes, Ed Byrne, Milton Jones, Nish Kumar and Romesh Ranganathan. Stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies sets tasks to Dave Gorman, Al Murray, Rob Beckett, Sara Pascoe and Paul Chowdhry, including a challenge involving a cement-filled shoebox.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: At South Devon, engineer Ray Lee is working to bring a loco back in to service. There is also a visit to the SS Kingswear paddle steamer In Dartmouth, the oldest vessel of its kind.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The role played by engineering giant Vickers during the Second World War, including the development of the Spitfire and how the Royal Navy recovered from losing so many warships.

programme.title: World's Greatest Palaces
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of Neuschwanstein Castle in the Alps of southern Germany. Created for eccentric king Ludwig the second in the 19th century, the castle is both a visual and engineering marvel that was an influence on Walt Disney. Containing a huge throne room and man-made cave, it took 17 years to build but was never fully completed after Ludwig was deposed, incarcerated and mysteriously died in 1868.

programme.title: World's Greatest Palaces
programme.desc: A look at Edinburgh Castle - a symbol of Scottish might that has been besieged more than 20 times and has existed in many guises, including a military fortress, prison and palace.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: The Lyell team investigates the murder of a family shot while picnicking by a river, and discover the female victim was in the middle of a bitter divorce. Local detective Malcolm Guillam is brought in to help and when the present-day murder reminds him of an unsolved case that haunts him, he sees an opportunity to redeem himself. However, DCI Sally Butcher is convinced that the woman's estranged husband is responsible for the murder and has no time for Guillam's trip down memory lane. Feature-length episode, guest starring Derek Griffiths.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: Lizzie must deal with her mother's bold defence of the York cause, while the appearance of a boy in Burgundy claiming to be a young prince threatens to further destabilise King Henry's rule. King Henry's mother Lady Margaret Beaufort faces the consequences of harbouring a dark secret. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Meryl and Carlito's relationship leaves the Knight family reeling, the tension between Hugh and Penny endangers the new cardiac clinic, and Matt reconnects with a high school crush.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: There are embarrassing results when Penny's personal feelings for Hugh spill over into the workplace, while Charlie and Matt attempt to cope with an unwanted house guest.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Tracey makes an appointment with a Harley Street specialist, hoping to allay her suspicions that she may be pregnant. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke, Linda Robson and Lesley Joseph.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Joy plans a party for the girls while the men are on their training exercise at the Army training ground. Meanwhile, Dave Tucker opens up about feeling depressed.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: In the final episode, the fusiliers attend the funeral of Tony Wilton. Elsewhere, Donna decides that it is time to move out.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Will's career hangs in the balance as the disciplinary hearing gets under way, but when he chooses to save a patient's life rather than attend the hearing, Connie is impressed by his devotion to duty and resolves to speak out on his behalf. Mickie decides to train as a doctor, leaving Donna concerned that this will spell the end of their friendship, while Mubbs objects to the new working hours. The hospital holds a charity trolley dash, which helps bring Tricia and Carlos closer together, while the tension between Ric and Jess escalates, leaving them open to blackmail.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Things look grim for Adam as the day of his trial dawns, until Andrea and Neil manage to expose Jerome Taylor's dirty dealings, while investigations into the death of paedophile Malcolm Willard raise the alarming possibility that a serial sniper could be on the loose in Sun Hill. An angry exchange with Shirley adds to Yvonne's woes as she anxiously awaits the results of her HIV tests.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Jack questions the wisdom of Adam's decision to alert the officers to the presence of a serial sniper on the streets of Sun Hill, while undercover journalist Andrea debates whether to cave in to pressure from her editor and deliver a sensationalistic story that could terrify the local population. Steve is unimpressed with Lance's handling of a hostage situation and resorts to extreme measures to express his displeasure.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Sharon has the unpleasant task of telling Pete about the buyer of the Mitchells' flat. Frank is behind with the book-keeping and Arthur has been avoiding Mark as much as possible.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: The strain on the Fowler family is beginning to show - it can't be long before something or someone cracks. Will Pete tell Kathy before she hears the news from someone else?.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Easter approaches in the spring of 1961, and Patsy helps to deliver a baby that is born with severe deformities. Her husband struggles to cope with his daughter's needs, but the sisters rally round to support the family. Trixie teaches a keep fit class which results in a medical emergency, leaving her determined to teach her patients to understand their own bodies.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Barbara treats a pregnant woman whose dockworker husband is struggling to support her as opportunities for work dry up. She is forced into a difficult decision that leaves Barbara facing the biggest test of her career. Nurse Crane meets a kindred spirit when she learns to speak Spanish, and Sister Evangelina helps a woman with breastfeeding, leading to unforeseen consequences.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: A rare disease spreads around Poplar Street, and Patsy and Dr Turner try to trace the outbreak to its source. Suspicion over the identity of the first carrier threatens to divide a previously close-knit family. Sister Winifred is forced to confront her prejudices while treating a patient, and Barbara worries about how Trixie will react when she agrees to go to dinner with Tom.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Sister Julienne is seconded to a maternity ward, and is impressed by how modern technology is being used to help the mothers - but is left with a moral dilemma after assisting on a traumatic birth. A young man from Poplar is delighted to be accepted into university, but his mother is less than happy. His dreams are jeopardised when his girlfriend gets pregnant, a development that puts pressure on the whole family.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Patrick searches for his father, while Stephen aspires to be a celebrity.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The apparent suicide of a troubled student at Upcott Seminary leads Father Brown to believe a murderer is at work, and he tries to persuade Sid to go undercover in an attempt to flush out the killer. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: The Caribbean cops enter the high-pressure world of fine dining when a famous chef is found stabbed to death the morning after the opening of his new restaurant. It proves to be a tricky investigation as the body was stored in a freezer, so the time of death cannot be identified - and when it turns out he was quite a hot-head in the kitchen, all his staff come under suspicion. Away from the case, Dwayne meets his match in the shape of a troublesome schoolboy, Florence has one last lesson in love for the inspector and JP makes a life-changing decision. Tara FitzGerald and Martin Compston guest star.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: A severed finger is brought to the Lyell Centre by DCI Rory Goodchild and immigration enforcement officer Pia Butler, who ask Nikki and Thomas to test for a DNA match with 17 year-old Syrian illegal immigrant Akka Khoury. The teenager was sent the digit by a people-smuggler who claims to have her mother and is demanding money for her safe return. Meanwhile, Akka's 12 year-old cousin Sosa is trying to enter the UK illegally hidden in a van on a cross-channel ferry. Emilia Fox stars.

programme.title: Four Christmases (2008)
programme.desc: A couple have always managed to avoid family festivities by travelling overseas. However, when their flight is cancelled, each of their divorced parents insists they spend yuletide with them - forcing the pair to get through a quartet of Christmas celebrations on the same day. Comedy, starring Vince Vaughn and Reese Witherspoon.

programme.title: Britain's Top 100 Dogs: 2019
programme.desc: Ben Fogle and Sara Cox count down the nation's favourite dog breeds, with the top 10 decided by a public vote. The programme features fascinating facts about the heritage, key characteristics and personality traits of every breed in the top 100 chart, as well as a host of famous faces - including Harry Redknapp, Penny Lancaster, Gemma Atkinson and Martin and Shirley Kemp - sharing stories about their bond with their four-legged friends. There are also funny and heartwarming dog-related stories from across the country.

programme.title: Who's Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: TV singers and vocal coaches Carrie and David Grant are today's VIP cooks, providing the food for Team Uniform - comprising a policeman, a vicar, a fireman and a midwife - who have to guess their identities with the help of a few cryptic clues. If the guests are successful, they will be one step closer to winning the full cash prize - but if they fail, they will be the ones doing the washing up. Hosted by Brian McFadden.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Ainsley's Caribbean Kitchen
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott takes a culinary tour of the Caribbean, visiting the islands that have inspired his cooking. His first stop is Jamaica, where his father grew up. He visits the island's famous Coronation Market and a Rastafarian farm-to-table restaurant, where he learns to make ackee-stuffed ravioli. He also takes a trip to the villa where Ian Fleming created James Bond.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Fast flowing waters await Danny in today's dare as he takes on a white-water rafting course including the UK's steepest man-made drop..

programme.title: The Powerpuff Girls
programme.desc: Bubbles, Blossom and Buttercup fly into action once more.

programme.title: The Powerpuff Girls
programme.desc: Buttercup is not a fan of Bubbles' newly created digital assistant.

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: The teenage superheroes fight to save the world while getting up to mischievous antics.

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: The teenage superheroes fight to save the world while getting up to mischievous antics.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Fuzzypeg eats the Spuds' fish supper and Dave has to catch another. Things look up when he hooks something, but it turns out to be a whale..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: George takes Dave on an adventure camping, but Dave isn't sure it's a great idea. He's proved right when they both wake up in a bear's cave..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: George takes the Spuds to the museum of mouldy cheese. Anna dares Dave to lick the cheeses on display, and Dave's bad breath wakes one of the exhibits up.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Betty wants a nice photo of Dave and Anna, but the camera George uses happens to belong to Gran, and it's been cursed by an ancient mummy..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz beams himself into Weasel's brain in order to take out Magoo with tranquilliser darts. Magoo loses Mr Cat and enlists his neighbour to find him..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo thinks he's in a triathlon and takes Fizz's superhuman strength headband, which Fizz needs to beat the President at a thumb war.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Today's the big day, and Magoo believes he is in a recording studio to make a hit single for famous producer, Phil Dustspeck. But is that really true?.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Spurred into action by the discovery of a woman's body in Midsomer Worthy's Raven's Wood, Barnaby and Troy re-examine three similar unsolved murders in the same village nine years previously, hoping to get a lead before the killer strikes again. As they dig deeper into the clandestine world of the community, they find themselves embroiled in a sinister web of deceit, violence and mystery. Guest starring Toby Jones and Phyllis Logan.

programme.title: You've Been Framed!
programme.desc: Harry Hill revisits some of the nation's favourite funniest videos, using his unique narration to turn viewers' slapstick into celebrity satire - but who will earn a place in the hall of fame?.

programme.title: ITV Racing Live
programme.sub-title: Racing on STV: Live from Kempton
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin presents coverage of the 3.05 Ladbrokes King George VI Steeple Chase from Kempton Park, which follows races at 1.20, 1.55 and 2.30. Plus, a race from 2.10 at Wetherby. With analysis from Ruby Walsh and AP McCoy, reports by Mick Fitzgerald, Luke Harvey, Matt Chapman and Sally Ann Grassick, and commentary from Richard Hoiles.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Compilation of some of the most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, in which the last contestant standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: Tenable All Stars
programme.desc: Warwick Davis presents a Christmas-themed version of the Top 10 general knowledge quiz. Joining him are a star-studded team of panto celebrities - Debbie McGee, Louie Spence, Paul Chuckle, Rustie Lee and Paul Zerdin - who'll be taking on the Tenable Tower for the chance to win 125,000 for their chosen charities.

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts a festive special of the game show from Manchester, where he sets members of the public unusual Christmas-themed challenges and unwraps a variety of hilarious games.

programme.title: Paul O'Grady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.sub-title: Paul O'Grady: For the Love of Dogs at Christmas
programme.desc: The comedian helps out at Battersea Dogs & Cats Home over the festive period, where he is enlisted to help pooches with behavioural problems. They include a reclusive mongrel that refuses to leave its kennel and a grumpy Yorkshire terrier that refuses to walk. Paul also helps an overprotective staffie mum struggling to say goodbye to her pups and an excitable one-year-old puppy that just cannot stop having little accidents. He also gets out and about with the street vets to bring festive joy to London's homeless and their dogs.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Graham pleads his case to Rhona, David is determined to keep things quiet, and Nicola reaches out to Laurel.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Following one of the most dramatic Christmas Days in Weatherfield history, the long-suffering Street residents come to terms with the aftermath and try to get their lives back in order.

programme.title: Skyfall (2012)
programme.desc: James Bond pursues a mysterious criminal mastermind who has orchestrated a terrorist attack on MI6 headquarters and exposed the identities of undercover agents around the world. The trail leads to a rogue former operative who has a personal vendetta against the intelligence organisation's leader M - who is also facing calls to retire. Sam Mendes directs the 23rd instalment in the spy franchise, starring Daniel Craig as 007, with Javier Bardem, Judi Dench, Ralph Fiennes, Naomie Harris and Ben Whishaw.

programme.title: The Jonathan Ross Show
programme.desc: The host welcomes another batch of celebrity guests to his famous green room for a special Christmas edition of the talk show. He is joined by David Tennant, whose demonic role in Terry Pratchett and Neil Gaiman's Good Omens will be coming to BBC in the new year, as well as singers Rita Ora and Jamie Cullum, former X Factor judge Sharon Osbourne, Strictly Come Dancing: It Takes Two presenter Rylan Clark-Neal, award-winning Hollywood star David Oyelowo and comedian Bec Hill.

programme.title: The Brilliantly Big Xmas Quiz! Top 20

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how wrecker trucks are built, the production of Roquefort and the transportation of trees.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer travels to America in search of a Willys Jeep, but the vehicle he finds needs major repairs and high transport costs to the UK could jeopardise his making a profit.

programme.title: Al Murray's Great British Pub Quiz
programme.desc: Al, aided by barman Shaun Williamson and captains Marcus Brigstocke and Ed Byrne, oversees a clash between The Cock Inn from West Sussex and The King Malcolm from Fife.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Footage of dramatic road-based clashes, as drivers and pedestrians unleash their rage, creating chaos on the highways. Plus, coverage of a cringe-worthy crossing incident.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Real-life footage of vehicles spinning wildly out of control, and avoidable disasters that ended in pointless injuries.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A drag boat disintegrates while travelling at 180mph, a huge explosion rips through the roof of a dormitory and a sprint car crashes at 120mph.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A fuel transfer causes multiple explosions, a base jumper is swept into a raging waterfall and a man is saved from drowning after his helicopter crashes into water.

programme.title: Swamp Loggers
programme.desc: Bobby finds a tract of high value timber, but the crew must navigate treacherous roads to acquire the record loads the trees promise.

programme.title: Overhaulin'
programme.desc: The team works on a exciting, wheelchair-friendly Mustang, and Mike is mercilessly pranked while his ride is radicalised.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini is hired to sell an Eliminator roadster, owned by automotive journalist Brock Yates, but he must first pick the vehicle up from the Saratoga Automobile Museum.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Derek Hill - the son of legendary auto racer Phil Hill - brings his father's 1912 Packard to the Pebble Beach Concours d'Elegance.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini searches for more high-end resoration projects, and uncovers numerous Mopar cars, a 1905 Cadillac and a Ferrari 330

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini gets a lead on a cache of three 308 Ferraris. Then, while Roger works on a belt job, Wayne puts on his sales hat to drum up clients for two more Ferraris - a 275 and a 430

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: To celebrate their 100th car, Mike Brewer and Edd China restore a Darracq Type L. However, it remains to be seen whether they will be ready in time to face the famous London to Brighton run.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mechanic Edd China surprises auto enthusiast Mike Brewer Mike back in England by purchasing a vintage 1916 Cadillac. The duo work hard to get the car ready for a 9,000-mile endurance rally known as Peking to Paris.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer searches for a 1957 Thunderbird, marketed as one of the world's first luxury cars, which sold healthily in its day.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: After purchasing a badly modified DeSoto Firedome, Mike Brewer and Edd China set about addressing the damage to give the stunning cruiser back some of its class.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer manages to find an inexpensive MGB GT in urgent need of repair and enlists the help of mechanic Edd China to restore it to its former glory.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. The MGB GT restoration continues as Mike Brewer and Edd China do their utmost to get the classic car back on the road.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer and Edd China try to transform a Mini City 1000 to celebrate the car's 50th anniversary on a budget of 5,000

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. After buying a Mini City 1000 for 700, Mike Brewer plans to showcase the car at the three-day 50th birthday celebration of the vehicle in Birmingham. The only problem is that mechanic Edd China still has to complete the work necessary to restore it to its former glory.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer travels to Yorkshire to examine a TVR S2 that is up for auction.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Edd China experiences a series of problems while working on the TVR S2, which leaves Mike Brewer wondering if it will be ready for him in time to sell at a profit.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer goes in search of a Jensen Interceptor, but his 5,000 budget restricts him to poor examples of the car, leaving mechanic Edd China with plenty of work to do.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Edd China and Mike Brewer set the challenge to find the ultimate bug-out vehicle that would ceaselessly run, and decide on the Land Rover Series IIA.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer tracks down a TVR Cerbera for 8,000, and Edd China works on restoring this classic sports car so it may be sold on for a profit.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer heads to Italy to grab a genuine junior supercar, but when he arrives back in the UK, expert technician Edd China realises that extensive work needs doing.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Edd China work on an old Aston Martin DB7, hoping to restore it to its former glory but hidden problems threaten to blow their budget.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: In Gloucestershire, Drew Pritchard finds a huge horse's head with a dealer specialising in sculptures. In Somerset he spots a valuable Persian rug lining a chicken shed.

programme.title: EFL on Quest
programme.desc: A round-up of goals and highlights from the English Football League, including Leeds United v Preston North End and Barnsley v West Bromwich Albion.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how marble is produced, the building of escape slides and how mah-jong pieces are made.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The manufacture of Kamaz trucks and hair-care products and the construction of Chinese landmark building the Canton Tower.

programme.title: Body Bizarre
programme.desc: Featuring triplets undergoing a second round of life-saving surgeries, an Argentinian with unusually long limbs and an extraordinary story in Brazil.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: When 69-year-old Ina Clare Richardson was found brutally murdered in a park, police turned to security cameras to piece together the puzzle of her death.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of Carl Starke, shot dead close to his home in Florida. Police turned to CCTV to help hunt his killer, resulting in a huge manhunt and shocking on-camera interview.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How convictions were secured in three murder cases through the gathering of trace evidence, including luminol blood testing and fingerprinting.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Forensic evidence is used to confirm suspicions a patrolman was responsible for the rape and murder of a woman on a California highway.

programme.title: Animal Cops Detroit
programme.desc: The investigators find their work cut out for them on a bitterly cold day after receiving reports that a dog has been spotted without shelter and is causing a disturbance.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris takes us into the world of one of Sydney's busiest vets. A labrador is brought in with bulging eyeballs, and 60-year-old tortoise Hugo needs a mate.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A well-endowed customer finds her dress is going to cost more than expected, and another bride finds her mother does not approve of her risque dress ideas.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Assistant Chief investigator Charles Jantzen tries to save 70 cats and dogs from a run-down private animal rescue centre.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: A rookie animal carer wins the hearts of everyone at the Houston SPCA centre by performing emergency surgery on a dog that has a rusty metal chain embedded in its neck.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The team receives a report of 50 animals being held at the home of a suspected hoarder in Fayette County, Texas, and sets out to rescue them.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The investigators of the Houston SPCA look back on some of the most shocking cases of animal cruelty, from the thousands dealt with each year.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Chief investigator Jim Boller leads the mission to rescue a deer that has sustained severe injuries after running through a plate-glass window at an office.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: A senior investigator is injured and rushed to hospital while carrying out a raid at the home of an elderly collector of cats.

programme.title: The 50 Stone Man: Shocking Story
programme.desc: The story of obese man John Keitz who spent seven years in bed because his body could not support his weight, but died shortly after embarking on a weight-loss programme.

programme.title: 42 Stone Mum: One Year Later
programme.desc: A revisit to Dominique Lanoise, the mother-of-six who became housebound due to her ongoing weight gain. The progress she has made toward her goal of a normal life is revealed.

programme.title: My Shocking Story
programme.desc: The life of John Brandon, who at 5ft 6 and 28 stone is struggling to live his life and contemplating a major surgical procedure to help improve matters.

programme.title: 28 Stone Teenager - One Year Later: Shocking Story
programme.desc: An update on the progress of John Brandon, who underwent major surgery in an attempt to lose weight.

programme.title: The 685lb Teen
programme.desc: Justin Williamson is the most overweight teenager in the US and everyday life is tough. However, he has two goals - to get healthy and launch a singing career. This is his story.

programme.title: Obese and Expecting
programme.desc: Documentary following four morbidly obese pregnant women as they suffer health crises and relationship breakdowns, all while striving to deliver healthy babies.

programme.title: Long Lost Family US
programme.desc: A young woman hopes Chris Jacobs can help solve the 30-year old mystery of her younger brother's disappearance from a Miami Beach hotel.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Liz is bed bound with severe lymphedema making it impossible to walk. Isolated and friendless, she has depression, and lives with her mum who is too ill to care for her.

programme.title: Body Bizarre
programme.desc: A man who suffers from a devastatingly disfiguring disorder causing his body to be covered in benign tumours. Plus, more incredible human stories.

programme.title: Body Bizarre
programme.desc: A Frenchman with a rare shaking condition and an American woman with an enormous stomach tumour.
